question: A Service Catalog may include which of the following components?

options.B: Order Guides, Catalog Items, and Interceptors
options.C: Catalog Items, Asset Contracts, Task Surveys
options.D: Record Producers, Order Guides, and Catalog Items

question: Which one of the following statements applies to a set of fields when they are coalesced during an import?

options.A: If a match is found using the coalesce fields, the existing record is updated with the information being imported
options.B: If a match is not found using the coalesce fields, the system does not create a Transform Map
options.C: If a match is found using the coalesce fields, the system creates a new record
options.D: If a match is not found using the coalesce fields, the existing record is updated with the information being imported

question: As it relates to ServiceNow reporting, which of the following statements describes what a metric can do?

options.A: A metric is a report gauge used on homepages to display real-time data
options.B: A metric is a time measurement used to report the effectiveness of workflows and SLAs
options.C: A metric is used to measure and evaluate the effectiveness of IT service management processes
options.D: A metric is a comparative measurement used to report the effectiveness of flows and SLAs.

question: The display sequence is controlled in a Service Catalog Item using which of the following?

options.A: The Default Value field in the Catalog Item form
options.B: The Sequence field in the Catalog Item form
options.C: The Order field in the Variable form
options.D: The Choice field in the Variable form

question: Reports can be created from which different places in the platform? (Choose two.)
Knowledge Base Search results can be sorted by which of the following? (Choose three.)
What is the path an Administrator could take to view the fulfillment stage task list for an order placed by a user?
Which term refers to application menus and modules which you may want to access quickly and often?
What is generated from the Service Catalog once a user places an order for an item or service?
From the User menu, which actions can a user select? (Choose three.)
Buttons, form links, and context menu items are all examples of what type of functionality?
Which of the following is true of Service Catalog Items in relation to the Service Catalog?
Table Access Control rules are processed in the following order:

options.A: any table name (wildcard), parent table name, table name
options.B: table name, parent table name, any table name (wildcard)
options.C: parent table name, table name, any table name (wildcard)
options.D: any table name (wildcard), table name, parent table name

question: What is the platform name for the User table?
A REQ number in the Service Catalog represents…

options.D: the individual item in the order.

question: Which would NOT appear in the History section of the Application Navigator?
Which one of the following statements is a recommendation from ServiceNow about Update Sets?

options.A: Avoid using the Default Update set as an Update Set for moving customizations from instance to instance
options.B: Before moving customizations from instance to instance with Update Sets, ensure that both instances are different versions
options.C: Use the Baseline Update Set to store the contents of items after they are changed the first time
options.D: Once an Update Set is closed as "Complete", change it back to "In Progress" until it is applied to another instance

question: Which of the following is used to initiate a flow?
For Administrators creating new Service Catalog items, what is a characteristic they should know about Service Catalog variables?

options.A: Service Catalog variables can only be used in Record Producers
options.B: Service Catalog variables can only be used in Order Guides
options.C: Service Catalog variables cannot affect the order price
options.D: Service Catalog variables are global by default

question: Which one of the following statements is true about Column Context Menus?

options.A: It displays actions such as creating quick reports, configuring the list, and exporting data
options.B: It displays actions related to filtering options, assigning tags, and search
options.C: It displays actions related to viewing and filtering the entire list
options.D: It displays actions such as view form, view related task, and add relationship

question: Which ServiceNow products can be used to discover and populate the CMDB? (Choose two.)
When using the Load Data and Transform Map process, what is the Mapping Assist used for?

options.A: Mapping fields using the Import Log
options.D: Mapping fields using a Field Map

question: Which one of the following statements describes the contents of the Configuration Management Database (CMDB)?

options.A: The CMDB contains data about tangible and intangible business assets
options.B: The CMDB contains the Business Rules that direct the intangible, configurable assets used by a company
options.C: The CMDB archives all Service Management PaaS equipment metadata and usage statistics
options.D: The CMDB contains ITIL process data pertaining to configuration items

question: In what order should filter elements be specified?
Which statement is true about business rules?

options.A: A business rule must run before a database action occurs
options.B: A business rule can be a piece of Javascript
options.C: A business rule must not run before a database action occurs
options.D: A business rule monitors fields on a form

question: Which of the following are a type of client scripts supported in ServiceNow? (Choose four.)
Which type of tables may be extended by other tables, but do not extend another table?
Which of the following statement describes the purpose of an Order Guide?

options.A: Order Guides restrict the number of items in an order to only one item per request
options.B: Order Guide provide a list of guidelines for Administrators on how to set up item variables
options.C: Order Guide provide the ability to order multiple, related items as one request
options.D: Order Guides take the user directly to the checkout without prompting for information

question: Which tool is used to have conversations with logged-in users in real-time?
Which of the following concepts are associated with the ServiceNow CMDB? (Choose four.)
What is a formatter? Select one of the following.

options.A: A formatter allows you to configure applications on your instance
options.B: A formatter is a form element used to display information that is not a field in the record
options.C: A formatter allows you to populate fields automatically
options.D: A formatter is a set of conditions applied to a table to help find and work with data

question: When searching using the App Navigator search field, what can be returned? (Choose four.)
Which technique is used to get information from a series of referenced fields from different tables?
What is a schema map?

options.A: A schema map enables administrators to define records from specific tables as trouble sources for Configuration Items
options.B: A schema map graphically organizes the visual task boards for the CMDB
options.C: A schema map graphically displays the Configuration Items that support a business service
options.D: A schema map displays the details of tables and their relationships in a visual manner, allowing administrators to view and easily access different parts of the database schema

question: Which one of the following statements best describes the purpose of an Update Set?

options.A: An Update Set allows administrators to group a series of changes into a named set and then move this set as a unit to other systems
options.B: By default, an Update Set includes customizations, Business Rules, and homepages
options.C: An Update Set is a group of customizations that is moved from Production to Development
options.D: By default, the changes included in an Update Set are visible only in the instance to which they are applied

question: Which of the following can be customized through the Basic Configuration UI 16 module? (Choose three.)
What is the function of user impersonation?
What information does the System Dictionary contain?

options.A: The human-readable labels and language settings
options.B: The definition for each table and column
options.C: The information on how tables relate to each other
options.D: The language dictionary used for spell checking

question: When working on a form, what is the difference between Insert and Update operations?

options.A: Insert creates a new record and Update saves changes, both remain on the form
options.B: Insert creates a new record and Update saves changes, both exit the form
options.C: Insert saves changes and exits the form, Update saves changes and remains on the form
options.D: Insert saves changes and remains on the form, Update saves changes and exits the form

question: How is the Event Log different from the Event Registry?

options.A: Event Log contains generated Events, the Event Registry is a table of Event definitions
options.B: Event Log is formatted in the Log style, the Event Registry displays different fields
options.C: Event Log lists Events that were triggered by integrations, the Event Registry lists the Events that were triggered during the day (24-hour period)
options.D: Event Log is the same as the Event Registry

question: What is a Dictionary Override?

options.A: A Dictionary Override is an incoming customer update in an Update Set which applies to the same objects as a newer local customer update
options.B: A Dictionary Override is the addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have an effect on IT services
options.C: A Dictionary Override is a task within a flow that requests an action before the flow can continue
options.D: A Dictionary Override sets field properties in extended tables

question: Which group of permissions is used to control Application and Module access?
What is a Record Producer?

options.A: A Record Producer is a type of Catalog Item that is used for Requests, not Services
options.B: A Record Producer creates user records
options.C: A Record Producer is a type of Catalog Item that provides easy ordering by bundling requests
options.D: A Record Producer is a type of a Catalog Item that allows users to create task-based records from the Service Catalog

question: Create Incident, Password Reset, and Report outage: what do these services in the Service Catalog have in common?

options.A: They direct the user to a record producer
options.B: They direct the user to a catalog property
options.C: They direct the user to a catalog UI policy
options.D: They direct the user to a catalog client script

question: What is the Import Set Table?

options.A: A table where data will be placed, post-transformation
options.C: A staging area for imported records
options.D: A repository for Update Set information

question: What is a characteristic of importing data into ServiceNow?

options.A: An existing Transform Map can be used one time on the same import set
options.B: Coalesce fields are used only after running Transform
options.C: Any user can manage and set up import sets
options.D: An existing Transform Map can be used multiple times on the same import set

question: What module in the Service Catalog application does an Administrator access to begin creating a new item?
Which of the following allows a user to edit field values in a list without opening the form?
Which three Variable Types can be added to a Service Catalog Item?

options.C: Number List, Single Line Text, and Reference
options.D: Multiple Choice, Select Box, and Checkbox

question: How are Workflows moved between instances?

options.A: Workflows are moved using Update Sets
options.B: Workflows are moved using Transform Maps
options.C: Workflows are moved using Application Sets
options.D: Workflows cannot be moved between instances

question: The baseline Service Catalog homepage contains links to which of the following components?

options.A: Record Producers, Order Guides, and Catalog Items
options.B: Order Guides, Item Variables, and flows
options.C: Order Guides, Catalog Items, and flows
options.D: Record Producers, Order Guides, and Item Variables

question: Which of the following statements is true when a new table is created by extending another table?

options.A: The new table archives the parent table and assumed its roles in the database
options.B: The new table inherits all of the Business Rules, Client Scripts, and UI Policies of the parent table, but none of the existing fields
options.C: The new table inherits all of the fields of the parent table and can also contain new fields unique to itself
options.D: The new table inherits all of the fields, but does not inherit Access Control rules, Client Scripts, and UI Policies of the parent table

question: Where can Admins check which release is running on an ServiceNow instance?
A knowledge article must be which of the following states to display to a user?
What is the name of the conversational bot platform that provides assistance to help users obtain information, make decisions, and perform common tasks?
What is the purpose of a Related List?

options.B: To dot-walk to a core table

question: Which one of the following statements describes the purpose of a Service Catalog flow?

options.A: A Service Catalog flow generates three basic components: item variable types, tasks, and approvals
options.B: Although a Service Catalog flow cannot send notifications, the flow drives complex fulfillment processes
options.C: A Service Catalog flow is used to drive complex fulfillment processes and sends notifications to defined users or groups
options.D: A Service Catalog flow generates three basic components: item variable types, tasks, and notifications

question: Which term best describes something that is created, has worked performed upon it, and is eventually moved to a state of closed?
Which are valid Service Now User Authentication Methods? (Choose three.)
Access Control rules may be defined with which of the following permission requirements? (Choose three.)
Which section of the ServiceNow UI allows you to perform a global search?
How do you make a list filter available to everyone?

options.A: Make active, assign a name, and save
options.B: Assign a group, set visibility, and save
options.C: Assign a name, set visibility, and save
options.D: Make active, set visibility, and save

question: What would NOT appear in the Application Navigator if 'service' is typed into the filter field?
Which of the following is used to categorize, flag, and locate records?
Which tool should be used to populate commonly used fields in a form?
How is a group defined in ServiceNow?

options.A: A group is one record stored in the Group Type [sys_user_group_type] table
options.B: A group is one record stored in the Group [sys_user_group] table
options.C: A group defines a set of users that share the same location
options.D: A group defines a set of users that share the same job title

question: What is a role in ServiceNow?

options.A: A role is one record in the Role [user_sys_role] table
options.B: A role is a set of modules for a particular application
options.C: A role is one record in the Role [sys_user_role] table
options.D: A role is a persona used in Live Feed Chat

question: What is a Notification?

options.A: A new Knowledge article created by a Business Rule
options.B: A tool for alerting users that events that concern them have occurred
options.C: A message through Connect related to a Change Request

question: Which one of the following is NOT a type of Visual Task Board?
What is (are) best practice(s) regarding users/groups/roles? (Choose two.)

options.A: You should never assign roles to groups.
options.B: You should assign roles to users.
options.C: You should add users to groups.
options.D: You should assign roles to groups.

question: What are two ways to generate an Event? (Choose two.)
Which core table in the ServiceNow platform provides a series of standard fields used on each of the tables that extend it, such as the Incident [incident] and Problem [problem] tables?
Which of the following statements describes how data is organized in a table?

options.A: A column is a field in the database and a record is one user
options.B: A column is one field and a record is one row
options.C: A column is one field and a record is one column
options.D: A column contains data from one user and a record is one set of fields

question: What is a sys_id?

options.A: Unique 32-character identifier that is assigned to every record
options.D: Unique 64-character identifier that is assigned to every record

question: When creating a global custom table named 'abc', what is the table name that is automatically assigned by the platform?
Access Control rules may provide access security for which of the following database objects?

options.A: For a specific role, group, or user
options.B: For a specific row, column, or table
options.D: For a specific CMDB Configuration item

question: What is the primary application used to load data into ServiceNow?
Which of the following steps can be used to import new data into ServiceNow from a spreadsheet?

options.B: Load Data, Create Transform Map, Run Transform
options.C: Define Data Source, Select Transform Map, Run Transform
options.D: Select Import Set, Select Transform Map, Run Transform

question: Which tool is used for creating dependencies between configuration items in the CMDB?
What is the difference between a UI Policy and Data Policy?

options.A: Data Policies run when data is entered through the form, by an Import Set, or by web services, while UI Policies are set only by web services
options.B: Data Policies can be converted into UI Policies, but UI Policies cannot be converted into Data Policies
options.C: Data Policies run regardless of how data is entered into ServiceNow, while UI Policies are used for form interactions
options.D: Data Policies run only after UI Policies run successfully

question: Which one of the following is an accurate list of changes that are captured in an Update Set?

options.A: Changes made to: tables, forms, schedules, and client scripts
options.B: Changes made to: tables, forms, Business Rules, and data records
options.C: Changes made to: tables, forms, groups, and configuration items (CIs)
options.D: Changes made to: table, forms, views, and fields

question: What are the steps to retrieve an Update Set?

options.A: Verify Update Set is Complete, Retrieve, Preview, Apply
options.B: Verify Update Set is Complete, Test Connection, Apply
options.C: Verify Update Set is Complete, Test Connection, Commit
options.D: Verify Update Set is Complete, Retrieve, Preview, Commit

question: IntegrationHub enables execution of third-party APIs as a part of a flow. These integrations are referred to as
Which of the following protects applications by identifying and restricting access to available files and data?
Which one statement correctly describes Access Control rule evaluation?

options.A: Table access rules are evaluated from the general to the specific
options.B: If more than one rule applies to a record, the older rule is evaluated first
options.C: If a row level rule and a field level rule exist, both rules must be true before an operation is allowed
options.D: The role with the most permissions evaluates the rules first.

question: ServiceNow contains a resource which provides the following: A standard and shared set of service related definitions across ServiceNow products and platform that will enable and support true service level reporting. A CMDB framework across our products and platform that will enable and support multiple configuration strategies. What resource do these statements describe?

An IT manager is responsible for the Network and Hardware assignment groups, each group contains 5 team members. These team members are working on many tasks, but the manager cannot see any tasks on the Service Desk > My Groups Work list. What could explain this?

options.A: The Service Desk > My Groups Work list shows active work tasks that are not yet assigned.
options.B: The manager does not have the itil role.
options.C: The manager is not a member of the Service Desk group.
options.D: The manager is not a member of the Network and Hardware groups.
options.E: The Assignment Group manager field is empty.

question: What do you need to do before you can use an Application-based trigger in your flow?

options.C: Activate application spoke, and plug-ins as needed
options.D: Assign Application trigger role [sn_app_trigger_write] to SME

question: The ServiceNow platform includes which types of interfaces? (Choose three.)
Which of the following are not included in an Update Set, by default? (Choose four.)
You are showing your customer a new form that you have created for their new application. They would like to add a field to the form. Where could you do that? (Choose two.)

options.B: Right click on form header, select Configure > Form Layout
options.C: Click on context menu, select Configure > Form Designer

question: Which ServiceNow resource is a framework that ensures the data your ServiceNow application requires maps correctly to the appropriate CMDB tables?
What do you activate when you want to add applications or functionality within your development instance?
What field contains a record's 32-character, unique identifier?

Your company is giving all first line workers a special T-shirt as a recognition for their hard work. Management team wants a way for employees to order the T-shirt, with the ability to specify the preferred size and color. How would you ensure that only first line workers (non-managers) can submit the order?

options.A: Create Record Producer and use the Available For list to specify First Line [sn_first_line] role
options.B: Create Catalog Item and use the Not Available list to specify the Manager Group
options.C: Create Catalog Item and use the Available For list to specify ITIL [itil] role
options.D: Create Order Guide and use the User Criteria list to specify First Line [sn_first_line] role

question: What is used frequently to move customizations from one instance to another?
What icon do you use to change the label on a Favorite?
What needs to be specified, when creating a Business Rule? (Choose four.)
What feature can track the amount of time that a task has been open, to ensure that tasks are completed within an allotted time?

options.A: Click on filter breadcrumb, drag and drop on the Report > Create New module
options.B: Click Funnel, define filter conditions, click Create Report
options.C: Click Context Menu, select Create Report
options.D: Apply filter, right click on column header, select Bar Chart
options.E: Apply filter, right click on column header, select Create Report

question: What import utility do you use when the field names on the import set match the name of the fields on the Target table?
As an IT employee what interface would you use, if you wanted to browse internal IT documentation, like troubleshooting scripts and FAQs?
A new Service Desk employee in Latin America complains that the create dates and times are incorrect on their Incident list. What would you suggest to fix this issue?

options.B: Have them use the gear icon to set the employee's time zone.
options.C: Recommend they use Chrome, instead of Explorer.
options.D: Use the system properties to correct the instance's time zone.
options.E: Have them correct the time zone on their computer.

question: What are three security modules often used by the System Administrator? (Choose three.)
When testing a catalog item, having a manager approval flows, which of these best practices would you follow? (Choose three.)

options.A: Make sure the latest flows are activated.
options.B: Use the instance Incognito setting to quickly toggle between requester and approver.
options.C: Impersonate the requester to ensure the form works.
options.D: Make sure the requester's user record has a manager specified.
options.E: Create and select your Testing Update Set, before starting the test cases.
options.F: Use your Admin account, so you can approve the items quickly.

question: What is a no-code approach to control the mandatory or read-only state of a form field?
When moving multiple update sets at one time, what might you do to facilitate the move?
What is specified in an Access Control rule?

options.B: Table Schema, CRUD, and User Authentication
options.C: Object and Operation being secured; Permissions required to access the object

question: Which icon would you double click, to expand and collapse the list of all Applications and Modules?
What do you call any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver services?
A new service catalog item is being developed, but should only be visible to managers inside the HR Department. What method would you use to fulfill this requirement?

options.A: Specify the Dept_Mgr role on the catalog content block
options.B: Add the Department Manager group to the catalog item's user criteria
options.C: Add the Department Manager group to the catalog item's ACL
options.D: Only publish the item in the HR service catalog
options.E: Use a Dept_Mgr ACL on the HR service catalog

question: A user wants to create a set of filter conditions, where they want to show records which satisfy two conditions: Incidents where the state is Closed AND Incidents where Assignment Group is Network. After clicking the Funnel icon, what should the user do?

options.A: Define the first condition; click AND button; define second condition; click Run
options.B: Define the first condition; click AND button; define second condition; press enter
options.C: Define the first condition; click OR button; define second condition; press enter
options.D: Define the first condition; click > icon on breadcrumb, define second condition; click Run
options.E: Define the first condition; click > icon on breadcrumb, define second condition; press enter

question: Access Control rules are applied to a specific table, like the Incident table. What is the object name for a rule that is specific to the Incident table and the Major Incident field?

Two departments (HR Onboarding and Facilities) have come to you, asking for a way for employees to request event room set up services. The requirements are the same for the form and the task routing to the Facilities' assignment group. For HR, the item will be used primarily for the Onboarding coordinators, for employee orientation sessions. For Facilities, the item will be used for anyone in the company who needs room set up services. However, both departments have their own service catalogs. What do you do, to support these requirements?

options.A: Create one Catalog Item for HR Event Room Set Up and one for Facilities Event Room Set Up; then publish each to the appropriate Catalog.
options.B: Create one Catalog Item for Event Room Set Up; then publish to both Catalogs.
options.C: Create one Catalog Item for Event Room Set Up; then publish to the Parent Catalog, which is accessible to both HR and Facilities.
options.D: Create one Catalog Item for Event Room Set Up; then use ACLs to control access.

question: After finishing your work on High Security Settings, what do you do to return to normal admin security levels?

options.C: Use System Administration > Normal Security module

question: What type of field allows you to look up values from one other table?
Which module would you use to create a new automation of business logic such as approvals, tasks, and notifications?
A department manager asks an analyst to build some reports. Where do you recommend the analyst start?
What are the steps for applying an update set to an instance?
When importing spreadsheet data into ServiceNow, in which step does the data get written to the receiving table?
What would you do, on a list, if you wanted to show the records in groups, based on the column category? (Choose two.)

options.A: On list Context Menu, select Group By > Category
options.B: On the Filter Menu, select Group By > Category
options.C: Click Group On icon, select Category
options.D: On Navigator Filter, type tablename.group.category and press enter
options.E: On the Category column title, click Context menu > Group By Category

question: Which collaboration tool is available from the banner, using the bubble icon?
On the knowledge base record, which tab would you use to define which users are not able to write articles to the knowledge base?
Which features allow you to update multiple records at one time? (Choose two.)
Categories in the knowledge base, by default, can be created and edited by which knowledge workers? (Choose two.)
Which collaboration tool opens a sidebar and allows you to create new conversations with other ServiceNow users?
What module would you use if you wanted to view a list of all of the fields on the Incident table? (Choose two.)
What component causes a flow to run after a record has been created or updated?
What type of field is Boolean and appears as a check box?
Which module is used to access the knowledge bases which are available to you?

A customer requests the following data quality measures be added: Incident numbers should be read only, on all lists and forms, for all users. Short Description field should be mandatory, on all records, across all applications, on Insert. Which type of policy would you use to meet this requirement?
What type of user (persona) has clearly defined paths and workflows in the platform and have one or more roles (ie itil and approver_user)?
Which module would you use to customize your instances banner image, text and colors?
Which database provides a logical model of your company infrastructure by identifying, controlling, maintaining and verifying CIs that exist?
Which module is used as the first step for importing data?
When you need to orchestrate business processes across services with little technical user knowledge, which utility would you use?
When a user reports that they are not able to see modules on the application navigator, what can you do, to see what modules are visible to them?

options.A: Look up their password, so you can login with their account

question: What is a key difference between Reporting and Performance Analytics?

options.A: Performance Analytics contains snapshots of data taken over time; Reporting shows only the data as it is, at the moment the report is run.
options.B: Performance Analytics can show trends; Reports cannot.
options.C: Reports can be run on a scheduled basis; Performance Analytics cannot.
options.D: Performance Analytics data can be published to Dashboards; Reports cannot.
options.E: Performance Analytics shows KPIs; Reporting does not.

question: While showing a customer their incident form, they ask to change the Priority values to display their internal terminology P1, P2, P3, P4. They want it to be consistent across all Tasks. How would you do that? Right click on Priority and select what?
Your customer would like to create a new template to notify users who are affected by network outages at their site. Which module would you use to create a new notification?

options.A: Drag the table icon onto the flow definition
options.B: Use the condition builder to specify the desired values
options.C: Specify the source table on the data pill related list
options.D: Drag the data pill onto the flow definition
options.E: Add the table reference using the slush bucket

question: On the Reports page, what sections allow you to see which reports are visible to different audiences? (Choose four.)
Which tool is used to define relationships between fields in an import set table and a target table?
Which ServiceNow capability provides assistance to help users obtain information, make decisions, and perform common work tasks via a messaging interface?
Which feature allows you to automate business logic for a particular application or process such as approvals, tasks notifications, and record operations?
From a form, what would you click to add additional fields to the form? (Choose two.)

options.D: Right click on header > Add > Field
options.F: Right click on header > Configure > UX Dashboard

question: What is the name of the table relationship, where two or more tables are related in a bi-directional relationship, so that the related records are visible from both tables in a related list?
On a Form header, what is the three bar icon called?
Group records are stored in which table?
What function do you use to add buttons, links, and context menu items on forms and lists?
On a Business Rule, the When setting determines at what point the rule executes. What are the options for specifying that timing?
What are different types of Data Sources, which may be imported into ServiceNow? (Choose four.)
What are the components that make up a filter condition? (Choose three.)
When impersonating a user for testing purposes, what is the best way to return the instance, logged in with your user account?

options.A: Turn your computer off and on again

question: What controls the publishing and retiring process for knowledge articles?
What type of query allows you to filter list data using normal words, instead of the condition builder?
Tables may have a One to Many relationships. From the Service Catalog, what are examples of tables having a one to many relationships? (Choose three.)

options.A: One Approval can have many Requests
options.B: One Request can have many Requested Items
options.C: One Requested Item can have many Approvals
options.D: One Requested Item can have many Catalog Tasks
options.E: One Cart can have many Requests

question: On a filter condition, which component is always a choice list?
A Role is defined as what?

options.B: A set of user access policies
options.D: A set of access control rules

question: A user is complaining that they are seeing a blank page, when they click Create New, from your custom Inventory application. You have confirmed that they can see the Inventory application, and the Create New module on the application navigator. What could be the cause of this issue?

options.A: Create New module has a broken link
options.C: User should be using Chrome instead of Explorer for their browser
options.D: User has read role, but not the write role on the Inventory table

question: What resource can you use to view details of the tables and configuration items (CIs) associated with a particular use case?

options.D: Common Service Data Model (CSDM) product view

question: A manager wants to view a snapshot of month-end Sales performance data, as compared to Sales targets. In addition, the manager wants to be able to see those monthly numbers trended over time, and forecasted into the future. What capability do you suggest for this manager?

options.A: Scheduled Reports, a custom snapshot table, and a Trend report
options.C: Scheduled Reports, a custom snapshot table, and a Projection report

question: What are advantages of using Flow Designer? (Choose three.)
Your customer requires that they be able to monitor which users are performing impersonations in their instance. What would you do to meet that requirement?

options.A: Add the role Log Write [sn_log_write] to the Impersonator Group
options.B: Create user update set for impersonation tracking
options.D: From User icon, select Elevate Roles
options.E: On the Impersonator role record, right click and select Create Log

question: When a flow runs an action, it generates a runtime value, which stays the same for the duration of the flow. What is the name of this runtime value?
The wait time for end users is based on the round-trip between the client and the server. What activities are included in the round-trips?
When importing data, what happens to imported rows, if no coalesce field is specified?

options.A: All rows are rejected from the import, as coalesce field is required.
options.B: All rows are treated as new records. No existing records are updated.
options.C: Duplicate rows are rejected from the import.
options.D: All rows are treated as new records, but errors will be flagged in the import log.

question: What is the most common role that has access to almost all platform features, functions, and data?
What feature do you use to specify which users are able to access a Service Catalog Item?
Which component of a table contains a piece of data for one record?
What type of field has a drop down list, from which you can pick from pre-defined options?
User records are stored in which table?
What ServiceNow feature can be triggered by events, and is used to inform users about activities or updates in ServiceNow?
Which ServiceNow capability allows you to provide knowledge articles, via a conversational messaging interface?
Which role can manage multiple knowledge bases?
Which statement correctly describes the differences between a Client Script and a Business Rule?

options.A: A Client Script executes before a record is loaded and a Business Rule executes after a record is loaded
options.B: A Client Script executes on the server and a Business Rule executes on the client
options.C: A Client Script executes on the client and a Business Rule executes on the server
options.D: A Client Script executes before a record is loaded and a Business Rule executes after a record is updated

question: What are benefits of assigning work tasks to a group, rather than to an individual? (Choose four.)

options.A: Group members can choose their tasks from My Groups Work
options.B: Groups can assign tasks to users based on on-call schedules
options.C: Site support members can pick tasks, based on Location
options.D: Groups can assign tasks to users based on skills
options.E: Group members can avoid tasks, which are nearing SLA breach
options.F: Groups can assign tasks to users based on availability

question: What ServiceNow feature allows you to include data from a secondary related table on a report?
What attributes can you manage, using System Properties > Basic Configuration UI16? (Choose five.)
Which field (or fields) is used as a unique key during imports?

You are asked to create an option in the Service Catalog, which will allow a user to click Get Help and describe the issue they are having. These forms should create incident records, which are automatically routed to the Service Desk. Which method would you use?
What is the result of the order in which access controls are evaluated?

options.A: Ensures user has access to the fields in a table, before considering their access to the table
options.B: Ensures user can get to work as quickly as possible
options.C: Ensures user has access to the application, before evaluating access to a module within the application
options.D: Ensures user has access to a table, before evaluating access to a field in the table

question: Which tool graphically displays an infrastructure view for a configuration item (CI) and its relationship with other CIs?
What are examples of Core tables in the ServiceNow platform?
Which tab on the knowledge base record, would you use to identify the sets of users who are able to read articles in that knowledge base?
What are the main components of the Form Design interface? (Choose three.)
What is used to determine user access to knowledge bases or a knowledge article?
What are the three key tables in an enterprise CMDB? (Choose three.)
What is the best practice related to using the Default Update Set for moving customizations between instances?

options.A: Merge Default update sets before moving between instances
options.B: Submit Default update set to application repository
options.C: You should not use the Default Update sets for moving between instances
options.D: Keep Default update set to maximum of 20 records, for troubleshooting purposes

question: On what part of the ServiceNow instance, would you find the option to Impersonate User?
Which application is used primarily to load data into ServiceNow?
If a knowledge base has no access details specified, what users are able to read articles in that knowledge base?

options.B: Any user with an article's permalink

question: How would you define an Access Control, to allow a user with itil role to have permission to create incident records?

options.A: Name: incident.None; Operation: create; Role: itil
options.B: Name: incident.Any; Operation: write; Permission: itil
options.C: Name: incident:*; Permission: write; Role: itil
options.D: Name: incident.None; Permission: create; Role: itil

question: What Service Catalog feature do you use to organize items into logical groups?
When creating a new notification, what must you define? (Choose three.)

options.B: Settings for handing inactive user accounts
options.C: Under what conditions is the notification sent
options.E: What the content of the notification

question: The ServiceNow platform supports a wide variety of plug-and-play applications. You can choose from the included workflows of build your own workflow: Which of these workflows are included in the platform? (Choose three.)

An IT manager is responsible for the Network and Hardware assignment groups, each group contains 5 team members. These team members are working on many tasks, but the manager cannot see any tasks on the Service Desk > My Groups Work list. What could explain this?

options.A: The Assignment Group manager field is empty.
options.B: The manager does not have the itil role.
options.C: The manager is not a member of the Service Desk group.
options.D: The manager is not a member of the Network and Hardware groups.

question: You have been asked to configure a form so an employee could order tablet and select the standard accessory options to purchase with it. These standard options are: carrying case, screen cleaner, tablet stand, and screen protector. What approach would you take? (Choose three.)

options.A: Create Catalog Item for the Tablet, and add a variable set to the form, for the accessory options.
options.B: Create a Record producer, and on the form, add a check box variable for each accessory option.
options.C: On Shopping Cart configuration, select option lo show the Add Accessories button.
options.D: Create one Catalog item for each: tablet, carrying case, screen cleaner, tablet stand, and screen protector.
options.E: Create Catalog Item for the tablet, and on the form, add a check box variable for each accessory option.

question: Which ServiceNow utility provides a modern interactive graphical interface to visualize configuration items and their relationships?
What is the definition of a group?

options.A: A collection of subject matter experts

question: On the Reports page, what sections allow you to see which reports are visible to different audiences? (Choose four.)
On a filter condition, there is an element, which is based on the table, the user access rights, and columns on the table. What is this element called?

You have been asked to create a way for users to order a new iPhone, but only if they get two levels of approval. The approvers and users should be automatically notified at each approval level. What feature would you use to manage the approvals and notifications?
Groups are stored in what table?
When managing tags, you can adjust who is able to see it. What are the visibility options? (Choose three.)
What module enables an administrator to define destinations for imported data on any ServiceNow table?
On the Form header, which icon do you use to access form templates?
When using the Data Pill Picker, use which keys to dot-walk to fields in other tables?
In what order are Access Controls evaluated?

options.A: Field-level - most specific to most general; then Table-level - most specific to most general
options.B: Field-level - most general to most specific; then Row-level - most specific to most general
options.C: Table-level - most specific to most general; then Field-level - most specific to most general
options.D: Table-level - most specific to most general, then Row-level - most specific to most general

question: What instance resource allows you to access guided tours, information about actions, and instructions on how to use inputs and outputs in your flow?
The Report Designer contains different sections for configuring your report. Which section is used to specify grouping and calculations to be run against the data?
What icon do you use to change the icon and color on a Favorite?

You have heard about a new application released by ServiceNow. You want to try it out, to see if it might be useful for your company's ServiceNow implementation. What would be the best way to get hands-on experience with the new application?

options.A: Search the wiki for the sales demo request form
options.B: Check the latest release notes at docs servicenow.com
options.C: Activate the application plug in, on your personal dev instance
options.D: Activate the application plug in, on your company's production instance.

question: When looking at a long list of records, you want to quickly filter, to show only those which have Category of Hardware. How might you do that?

options.A: On the Category column header, right click and select Show > Hardware
options.B: Right click on magnifier, type Hardware and click enter
options.C: On the list, locate and right click on the value Hardware, select Show Matching
options.D: On Breadcrumb, click > icon, type Hardware and click enter
options.E: Click Funnel icon, type Hardware and click enter

question: When looking at a long list of records, you want to quickly filter, to show only those which have Short Description containing email. How might you do that?

options.A: Click List Magnifier to expand column search, on Short Description, type email, click enter
options.B: On Search box, select text, type email, click enter
options.C: Click List Magnifier to expand column search, on Short Description, type *email, click enter
options.D: Click List Magnifier to expand column search, on Short Description, type %email, click enter

question: When importing spreadsheet data into ServiceNow, what is the first step in the process?
Tables may be set up with Many to Many relationships. What is a classic example of a scenario where the tables would have many to many relationships?

options.A: Vendors can sell multiple products; and products can be sold by multiple vendors.
options.B: A Task can trigger many Workflows; and a Workflow can trigger many Tasks.
options.C: Requests can contain many Items; and Items can be any item from the catalog.
options.D: A Configuration Item can belong to multiple Classes, and Classes can contain multiple Configuration Items.

question: What section on a task record would you use to see the most recent update made to a record?
The Employee On-boarding team has asked for a way for managers to order computers, monitors, business cards, and cell phones for new employees. How would you proceed to meet this requirement?
On the CI Dependency View, what enables you to trace from an infrastructure item, like a Server, to the Services that are dependent on that Server?
From a related list, what would a user click to personalize the layout of the columns?
What is the language used for scripting in ServiceNow?
What are examples of UI Actions, relating to Lists? (Choose four.)

A Service Catalog project will involve building 80 catalog items. For each of the catalog items, the following fields will be mandatory on the forms: Requested for, Requested by, Approving manager, Delivery instructions. All of the other variables will be specific to the individual catalog item. What features would you use when designing the catalog item form?

options.A: Create a Variable Set Template, then apply to all of the catalog items.
options.B: Create one Variable Set for the four variables, then add that variable set to each of the 80 catalog items.
options.C: Create a Record Producer that contains the four fields; then add to the record producer related list on the Catalog Items.
options.D: Create a Flow Designer Action, with Variable Set Data Pill, then apply flow to all of the 80 catalog items.
options.E: Create an Order Guide, which includes all variables; then copy and hide variables as needed.

question: A task worker asks how they can monitor any updates occurring to records assigned to him, like responses from customers. What do you suggest?

options.A: On My Work list, select the Activity Stream icon to show a frame with live updates
options.B: Click on the eyeglass icon to expand the Monitor frame
options.C: Open an Agent workspace tab for each record he wants to monitor
options.D: Select Service Desk > My Work Dashboard

question: What access does a user need to be able to import articles to a knowledge base?

options.A: Select source file; Run automap; Transform data; Clean up target table
options.B: Identity source; Import transform map; Run transformer, Verify import
options.C: Setup LDAP; Test map; Create update set; Run import; Apply update set
options.D: Load the data; Create transform map; Transform data; Clean up import table

question: Which type of scripts run in the browser?

options.A: A user is a record stored in the Profile [sys_user_profile] table

options.A: Their user account does not have itil role
options.B: Their user account was not approved by their manager
options.C: Their user account is not logged in properly
options.D: Their user account failed LDAP authentication
options.E: Their user account does not belong to any groups, which contain the itil role

options.A: Click on the Context menu, select Add Tag, type Special Handling, press enter

options.C: On the Tag field, select Special Handling from the choice list

question: What feature allows you to limit who is able to contribute or read knowledge within a knowledge base?

options.A: Manually add them to the update set
options.B: They cannot be moved via update set
options.C: They are automatically added to the update set

question: What is the platform name for the Group table?

On the knowledge base record, which tab would you use to define which users are not able to write articles to the knowledge base?
What types of entities can receive task assignments, in ServiceNow? (Choose two.)
The Report Designer contains different sections for configuring your report. Which section is used to adjust the look of your report, including colors, titles and legend layout?
How would you distinguish between a Base Class table and a Parent Class table?

options.A: Extended tables are always extended from Parent tables. Extended tables are usually extended from Base tables.
options.B: Extended tables can be extended from Parent tables or Base tables; but they cannot be extended from both.
options.C: Base Class tables always have tables extended from them. Parent tables do not have tables extended from them.
options.D: Base Class table is not extended from another table, Parent class tables may be extended from another table.

question: When a custom table is created, which access control rules are automatically created? (Choose four.)
Which banner icon do you use to change your personal system settings, like your instance color scheme?
Which banner icon do you use to change your personal system settings, like your instance color scheme?

options.A: The fields that are not in the base table.
options.B: The mandatory fields for the base table.
options.C: The fields that are specific to the extended table.
options.D: The reference fields for the base table.

question: While showing a customer their Incident form, they ask to change the Priority field title to display their internal terminology PValue. How would you do that? (Choose two.)

options.A: Right click on Priority and select Configure Label
options.B: Right click on Priority and select Configure Dictionary
options.C: Right click on Priority and select Configure Display Settings
options.D: Right click on Priority and select Configure Column

options.A: System Definition > Tables; Select Table; Go to Related links and click Show Schema Map
options.B: System Dictionary > Show Schema Map; Select Table

question: Which is the base table of the configuration management database hierarchy?

options.A: A field is a table row.
options.B: A field is an item that appears in a menu list.
options.C: A field is a table cell that stores data.
options.D: A field is a record in a table.

question: What are examples of UI Actions relating to forms? (Choose three.)

Here is an example of the criteria set for a knowledge base: Companies: ACME North America; Departments: HR; Groups: ACME Managers; Match All: Yes. In this example, what users would have access to this knowledge base?

options.A: Members of the ACME Manager group, who are also members of HR Department and part of ACME North America
options.B: Employees of ACME North America, who are members of HR Department or the ACME Managers group
options.C: Users which are members of either ACME North America, or HR Department, or ACME Managers group
options.D: Members of the ACME Managers group, and HR department, regardless of geography

question: In Flow Designer, where is the data from an action stored so it can be used in subsequent actions in the flow?

A customer has asked for the following updates to a form: Make Resolution code Mandatory, when state is changed to Resolved; Hide Major Incident check box, unless logged in user has Major Incident Manager role. What type of rule(s) would you use to implement this requirement?
What setting allows users to view a Knowledge Base article even if they are not logged in?
When adding a related list to a form, you choose the related list from the list collector. What is an example of a related list you might see on the list collector? (Choose three.)
How is the ServiceNow platform set up so that Administrators can easily configure their instances to send an email at the end of an upgrade?

options.A: Administrators can update the email notification named "System Upgraded" in the System Logs module by adding the appropriate User to receive it.
options.B: Administrators can update the email notification named "System Upgraded" in the Notifications module by adding the appropriate User to receive it.
options.C: Administrators can write a Client Script to send out an email to the Administrator when an Update is complete.
options.D: Administrators can write a Business Rule to send out an email to the Administrator when an Update is complete.

question: A customer wants to be able to identify and track components of their infrastructure that support their eCommerce service. What ServiceNow products could support this requirement? (Choose three.)

For your implementation, the following tables are extended from each other: Incident table is extended from Task table. Super Incident table is extended from Incident table. In this situation, which table(s) are Parent, Child and Base tables? (Choose five.)

options.A: Super Incident table is a Parent table
options.B: Incident table is a Child table
options.C: Super Incident table is a Base table
options.D: Incident table is a Base table
options.E: Task table is a Child table
options.F: Incident table is a Parent table
options.G: Super Incident table is a Child table
options.H: Task table is a Parent table
options.I: Task table is a Base table

options.A: Incident table has a one to many relationship with the Task table

question: You are looking at a list of Active Incidents. You want to exclude Incidents with the state of Resolved. How might you do that?

question: What module enables an administrator to define destinations for imported data on any ServiceNow table?

On a list, what does each row show?
Which action enables personalization in a form for the admin role, only?

options.A: Navigate to sys_form_properties.list and set the property glide.ui.enable_personalize_form.admin to true.
options.B: Navigate to Context Menu > Configure > Form Layout and select 'Enable Personalization' and Enter the 'admin' role.
options.C: Navigate to Context Menu > Configure > Table and add the role 'Admin' in the 'Available User' list box.
options.D: Navigate to sys_properties.list find the property glide.ui.personalize_form.role and set the Value to admin.

question: Which element is used to track items not saved with a field, in a record?
What does ServiceNow recommend as a best practice regarding data imports?

options.A: Adjust your Transform maps, after the data is loaded into the target table.
options.B: Use extremely large Import Sets, instead of multiple large Import Sets.
options.C: Create a new Import set table for each new data load.
options.D: Plan time before your import to remove obsolete or inaccurate data.
options.E: Monitor data quality and clean imported data, using the Data Scrub Workspace.

question: When an administrator sets a policy that is applied to all data entered into the Platform (UI, Import Sets, or Web Services), where does this policy run by default?
If a user is on an Incident form and is alerted when they change the value of the Priority field, which type of script executes in the Platform?
Which feature can be used to categorize a set of records from a list and make them visible to other users?

options.B: Provides built-in libraries /API for complex coding
options.D: Provides natural-language descriptions of flow logic
options.F: Supports easy integration with 3rd party systems

question: Which helps to visualize configuration items and their relationships?

options.B: Load Data, Create Transform Map, Run Transform
options.C: Define Data Source, Select Transform Map, Run Transform
options.D: Select Import Set, Select Transform Map, Run Transform

question: What contains the configuration changes made in an instance (i.e. changes in a form) and helps to implement the changes from the Dev environment to another environment?

In a Knowledge Base record, where can an administrator find the User Criteria for who can read the articles?
What action helps to see which modules are visible to a user?

options.A: Load the Update Set > Import the Update Set > Install
options.B: Verity Update Set is Complete, Retrieve, Preview, Commit
options.C: Verify Update Set is Complete, Test Connection, Apply
options.D: Import the Update Set > Verify the Update Set is complete > Link the Update Set > Publish

question: After finishing your work on High Security Settings, what is a possible way to return to normal admin security levels?

options.E: Use System Administration > Normal Security module

question: Which feature can be used to give users the choice to easily populate the most-used fields for a specific table?
What protects applications by restricting access to data in another application, in the same instance?
Which module in the Service Catalog application is used to create a new catalog item?
What helps to define the structure of a catalog item form that is displayed to the customer?
Which displays the list of activities, or history, on a form?
Where should an administrator navigate to add the "Save" button in the form header?

options.B: All > System Properties > UI Action Settings

question: What are the options that can be set to determine when a Business Rule executes? (Choose four.)
Which path is used on the Filter Navigator to display the list of records from the sys_user table?
Which access control rule applies to every field in the incident table?
What is the purpose of an application scope?

options.A: Scope determines which parts of an application are available for use by other applications In ServiceNow
options.B: Scope prevents applications from changing their own tables and business logic
options.C: Scope determines the functionality of core services in the platform
options.D: Scope determines all applications access each other's tables and business logic

options.B: Right-click the Priority Label > select Configure Lists
options.C: Right-click the Priority Label > select Configure Choices
options.D: Open the Data Dictionary > select Values

question: Which sequence of actions applies an update set to an instance?

options.A: When a user downloads a report
options.B: Before or after a user logs into the platform
options.C: Before or after a record is saved to the database
options.D: Only when a record is deleted

question: Your customer wants to update a notification so it is sent to the Caller's Manager. Which action supports this requirement?

options.A: On the 'Who will receive' tab on the Notification record add the Caller field, then dot walk to the Caller's Manager field to add it.

options.D: On the 'Send to' tab on the Notification record, set "Who will receive" to Subscribable.

question: A manager is complaining that they can't get the data they need on a report, because the data resides in two different tables. options.A: A notification appears asking the new user to collaborate
options.B: A chat bubble automatically launches, so you can collaborate
options.C: The Work notes list contains names of the other users
options.D: User presence icon shows initials of users actively viewing the record
